Reviews.Title: “its ok”
Reviews.Author: mac8156
Reviews.Content: hotel torenzicht is not for the faint of heart its situated smack in the middle of the rld but i found it ok for 65 euros a night and that includes a nice breakfast. if you do not mind the shared bathrooms and a basic room this fits the bill very well in expensive amsterdam. also the hotel bar is good . angus.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel, right in the middle of the city.”
Reviews.Author: Sam W Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Pros; Great room Great breakfast (English breakfast buffet, sausages, bacon, eggs, beans, mushrooms, also cheese, ham) Location right in the heart of the red light district Top floor attic room fantastic Great little shower Cons Its unfair to include stairs in the cons, all Amsterdam hotels in traditional buildings have steep stairs, if you don't like this, don't come to Amsterdam, or choose one of the souless modern hotels on the outskirts. The WiFi did not work as advertised in the top room, how many rooms are affected by the lack of WiFi i don't know.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Lee C Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This is perfect for a stag do, excellent location and value for money. Clean sheets on the bed and no sign of any bed bugs as stated in previous reviews.. Would stay again definitely. And stefan the bar man is really helpful and a good laugh.

Reviews.Title: “What more do you want”
Reviews.Author: Ryan B
Reviews.Content: Very cool place, right in the centre of the bustling area, after hours beer and party downstairs, stairs a bit difficult but then again no sleep does that to you, breakfast nice and staff helpful, jukebox awesome,

Reviews.Title: “a decent budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: stemac257
Reviews.Content: a group of 6 of went to amsterdam 7th nov 2011 for 3 nights, we arrived late evening at shipnol airport from there a 10 min train journey to central station and from there a 10 min walk into the red light district where this hotel is based bang in the middle of all the action, if your going to amsterdam for coffee shops, bars, ladies, sex shows and museums plus lots of sightseeing within walking distance, staying in this hotel is in the perfect location, when we stayed, they were renovating the exterior of the building but no disturbance to our stay. Â£40 pppn inc breakfast which is cheap for amsterdam arrived with fairly low expections and was pleasantly suprised, nice hotel, clean, friendly staff up for a laugh, 24hr bar. would recommend to someone wanting to go to amsterdam for the same reasons we did. we are already planning our next trip to amsterdam for march 2012 and we wil be satying at the torenzicht. we booked at hotelier.com this included city tax which alot of sites dont and you end up paying more when you arrive.

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jenja D
Reviews.Content: Rested in May with podrugoy.My from Russia. This hotel is like. The room was clean and spacious, separate shower. Good breakfast and friendly staff. in 2012 will stop there.

Reviews.Title: “Basic Hotel - Small & Safe in RLD.”
Reviews.Author: MICKGlasgow
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 3 nights in September 2011 as a solo traveller - cost Â£165.00 (little annoying that its advertised as Â£145 no taxes! on Easytobook.com then "city tax" is added when you arrive?). I was looking for hotels south of Damrak but, as seems to be the way in Amsterdam, prices are so high for average hotels. (Basically you will know that if you have been to Amsterdam before as i have that the hotels are not the best & in comparison make The Premier Inn look like the Hilton).. Was a bit worried as did not want to be in middle of RLD but was pleasantly surprised by the staff, hotel & room.. Location - on one of the canals in the RLD - opposite the Cassa Rosso Sex Theatre.. but if you get a room at the rear of the hotel its nice & quiet.. good location to see the sights - 5 mins to dam sqaure or Centraal station , 15 to rembrantplein & 30 to leidseplein & vondlepark areas.. Room - was given room on top / 3rd floor (room 37) which had twin beds, en suite shower, air con, TV would have been nice but not a big deal - it opened with a key card. The hotel had a 24 hour bar downstairs which closed its doors to non-residents at 01.00am which was excellent & made it feel a whole lot safer. The stairs are very steep to the top floors but got used to it. carpets a bit grubby & threadbare & could do with changing. Bed OK for comfort. Breakfast - Very Good buffet served till 9.00am only!! - Hot breakfast self service & also cold ham, bread cheese, jams etc, coffee, juice. Sets you up for the day.. Fantastic!! Staff - very pleasant & helpfull with any travel tips etc... All in all - decent budget hotel for a 1 or 2 night stay if you grab a good deal.. would consider staying again for a quick break..

Reviews.Title: “ideal hotel if you're not picky!”
Reviews.Author: neeeshxox
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel basically because it was a great price. The location was convenient and the rooms were very clean. The washrooms were a little bit uncomfortable (shared per floor, toilet/shower combined). The staircase was EXTREMELY narrow which can be bad if you're claustrophobic, or, if you plan to return to your hotel intoxicated with everything fun amsterdam has to offer. With that being said, I was still able to make it up the stairs so it is possible! Management is extremely nice. Breakfast was included really quite good - also a great selection of coffee/cappuccino/lattes included which was nice! And also important - no early check in but we were able to leave our luggage at the hotel bar and nothing was stolen - something which many guests at the hotel did! I gave it four stars because I had no problems with the hotel at all and would stay there again.. however it's not to say that it is a "four star" or luxurious hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel staff were very nice to us”
Reviews.Author: charmie728
Reviews.Content: Very convenient place to stay..minutes away from the central station.The staff were all very friendly,would love to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Stag do, perfect”
Reviews.Author: sineadmaguire0506
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights. Clean but basic room, friendly staff, cracking bar downstairs. Location fantastic for what we wanted- drinking, smoking and general stag do antics! Well worth booking!

Reviews.Title: “Ideal hotel”
Reviews.Author: mrcbbc
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel for location, value and friendliness.

Reviews.Title: “NASTY NASTY NASTY!!”
Reviews.Author: BigD121212
Reviews.Content: Booked hotel for 2 nights but after just one i had to check out and book into another as the room was dirty and i don't quite know what was all up the walls. As for the beds,i had to sleep in my clothes as the beds were dirty and smelly.The windows in our room only had enough curtain to cover half the window so the family with the small children who live opposite have a great view when they are eating their dinner.The noise from the other guests in the hotel and the street outside is unbelievable so don't expect much sleep.I wouldn't bother about the breakfast either unless you like rubber ham and cheese and cold toast.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: sloppychops
Reviews.Content: After staying here numerous times in the past, i feel that i should finally review the Hotel 'Torry'. First of all its right bang in the Red Light District, ideal if your with a group of lads and like minded lasses for that matter. But if your prudish in any way, i'd give it a miss. The bar doubles up as reception and its open 24 hours. Its really a good bar with a cracking computerised jukebox of about 1,000,000 songs on it , so something for everyone. The rooms are tired but clean enough, i've never had any problems. There are communal showers on each floor which i personly think is better rather than en-suite, as they tend to be cleaner. All in all i've never had a bad time here, though i think its pricey but i guess its all about location, location, location

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and Cheerful”
Reviews.Author: Wildthang330
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel Torenzicht with 3 pals (all 30 somethings). over a long weekend in November 2006. We stayed in the quad room which had it's own bathroom and shower. For 80 quid each (for the 3 nights) and staying in a capital city, we werent expecting much but we were pleasantly surprised. It was clean enough and we certainly didnt get bitten over the weekend (well not by any bugs or mites!!) The staff were friendly enough and the 24 hour bar was brilliant. They have a large screen showing all the footy and the bar is smoke friendly which is a bonus. Infact we spent a lot of the weekend sat in the bar (on the high seating area) with many pints of Oranje Boom and many biftas, watching the world go by!! Location is ideal...situated right in the middle of the red light district. Would defo recommend, infact it was that good me and my 3 mates have just booked up and and are going back again in June!!

Reviews.Title: “Wouldent stay there again!!”
Reviews.Author: MammaE
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Hotel Torenzicht was very basic Was o.k but certain people who stayed there let It down by going to the toilet on the toilet floors!! My freind and i ended up getting rashes up our legs from the bed linen. And there were funny stains on the walls. And also excrement up the toilet doors and floor. We ended up leaving the hotel a day early. And going sumwere else. We told the manager our reasons for leaving All she said was sorry and gave us a beer!! Not even a refund of money!. Will not be going there again very dissapointed.

Reviews.Title: “Book at your own risk”
Reviews.Author: pmgie
Reviews.Content: Had booked an apartment here a few months in advance only to be sent an email less than two weeks before we were meant to leave that the reservation had been cancelled due to an outbreak of legionella. This seemed like a valid excuse and we booked somewhere else. We decided to check out the apartment as we were passing and saw someone staying in the apartment watching TV. Very unprofessional and meant we had to fork out a lot more money to get another place at short notice.

Reviews.Title: “ideal location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: not far from central station and ideal for venturing out for excursions.Very hospitable and helpful staff with a good grasp of english. Despite being a one star hotel in the most popular part of amsterdam I had 3 nights of undisturbed sleep. Only problem was the very very steep stairs which are not ideal after a long days walk or a night out!!

Reviews.Title: “location location location....”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is clean, has a 24 hour bar and is the best placed for access to the redlight area and cafe bars. Staff are very friendly and helpful. Would not hesitate to go back.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Torenzicht
HotelInfo.Address: Oudezijds Achterburgwal 93, Amsterdam 1012 DD, The Netherlands
